# Timeline of the 2008 fighting in Lebanon

The timeline of events in the 2008 fighting in Lebanon is set out below.
Timeline
May
May 8, 2008
*1 Amal fighter, 30 civilians killed
In street battles in Beirut one Amal fighter and six civilians are killed, among the dead were two women and one child.[http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=41637 Lebanon news - NOW Lebanon :: If not now, when -Seven killed in Beirut fighting]
May 9, 2008
*7 Hezbollah fighters, 2 Lebanese Democratic Party (LDP) fighters, 1 pro-government fighter
In street battles in Beirut one pro-government and two LDP fighters were killed.[http://www.dailystar.com.lb/article.asp?edition_id=1&categ_id=2&article_id=91930 The Daily Star - Politics - Day 5: Lebanese dare to hope worst is over] In street battles in Aley eight people, including seven Hezbollah fighters, are killed.[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3541431,00.html Lebanon death toll up following northern clash - Israel News, Ynetnews] In sporadic clashes in Sidon a man and his wife were killed; and in Bar Elias in the Bekaa Valley a woman was killed also.
May 10, 2008
*10 SSNP members, 9 pro-government fighters, 2 Hezbollah fighters, 2 soldiers, 2 civilians, 1 Australian citizen killed
A gunman fired on the funeral procession of the government supporter, who was killed the previous day in Beirut, leaving two people dead and several wounded. At least 14 people were killed in northern Lebanon in the town of Halba in clashes between the rival supporters. 10 of the dead were SSNP members, three were government loyalists and one was an Australian citizen who was trying to get information at the SSNP offices about evacuating from the city.[http://hawkesbury.yourguide.com.au/news/national/national/general/australian-killed-in-lebanon-dfat/768453.aspx Australian killed in Lebanon: DFAT - National News - National - General - Hawkesbury Gazette]  Three Hezbollah fighters were attacked in Aley by pro-government Druze fighters leaving two of them dead and the third missing. Two soldiers were killed in fighting east of Beirut.[http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2008/05/10/49626.html Hezbollah withdrawing gunmen from Beirut] Another person was killed in clashes in Sidon. A woman was killed in heavy street battles in Tripoli late in the evening.
May 11, 2008
*17 pro-government fighters, 21 Hezbollah fighters, 2 civilians killed
In heavy ground and artillery battles in the mountain town of Chouweifat and surrounding villages 40 people, including 21 Hezbollah and 17 pro-government Druze fighters and two civilians,[http://wiredispatch.com/news/?id=164676 Heavy fighting breaks out in north Lebanon] were killed.[http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2008/05/12/49725.html Lebanon army gives gunmen deadline to disarm]
May 12, 2008
*1 civilian killed
In clashes in Tripoli one person was killed and at least six others wounded.[http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/9696FDD9-BE2C-4610-B5BB-D7FE88C2B003.htm Al Jazeera English – News – Fresh Clashes In North Lebanon]
June
June 17, 2008
*3 civilians killed
In clashes in the Bekaa Valley three civilians were killed.
June 22, 2008
*1 policeman, 8 civilians killed
In clashes in Tripoli one policeman and eight civilians were killed.
July
July 25, 2008
*1 policeman, 8 civilians killed
In clashes in Tripoli one policeman and eight civilians were killed. Among the dead were two women and a 10-year-old child.[http://www.thepeninsulaqatar.com/Display_news.asp?section=World_News&subsection=Gulf%2C+Middle+East+%26+Africa&month=July2008&file=World_News200807271463.xml The Peninsula On-line: Qatar's leading English Daily]
Casualties
Based on the above-mentioned reports 109 people were reported to have been killed and one is missing.
* Pro-government fighters: 27 killed
* Opposition fighters: 43 killed, 1 missing
* Lebanese Army: 2 killed
* Lebanese police: 2 killed
* Lebanese civilians: 34 killed*
* Foreign civilians: 1 (Australian)
*22 of the 34 were most certainly confirmed to have been civilians, with eight of them women, two children and twelve men.
